greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: A(n,k) is the number of binary matrices with k columns and any number of distinct nonzero rows with n ones in every column and columns in nonincreasing lexicographic order.
comment: The condition that the columns be in nonincreasing order is equivalent to considering nonequivalent matrices up to permutation of columns.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..209
formula: A(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..k} abs(Stirling1(k, j))*A331567(n, j)/k!.
A(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..k} binomial(k-1, k-j)*A331569(n, j).
program: D(p, n, k)={my(v=vector(n)); for(i=1, #p, v[p[i]]++); binomial(WeighT(v)[n] + k - 1, k)/prod(i=1, #v, i^v[i]*v[i]!)}

T(n, k)={ my(m=n*k+1, q=Vec(exp(intformal(O(x^m) - x^n/(1-x)))), f=Vec(serlaplace(1/(1+x) + O(x*x^m))/(x-1))); if(n==0, 1, sum(j=1, m, my(s=0); forpart(p=j, s+=(-1)^#p*D(p, n, k), [1, n]); s*sum(i=j, m, q[i-j+1]*f[i]))); }
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 20 2020
